cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles ENE of St. Thomas, 90 miles E of San Juan Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WNW, skirting just north of Puerto Rico tonight, then toward the Turks and Caicos and southeastern Bahamas Thursday and Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Turks and Caicos / southeastern Bahamas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cuba from Matanzas province eastward to Guantanamo province and the Central Bahamas (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: U.S. Virgin Islands, British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico (including Vieques & Culebra), northern Dominican Republic, northern Haiti, Southeastern Bahamas and Turks & Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, north coasts of Hispaniola, Turks and Caicos, southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force gusts likely; sustained tropical-storm to hurricane conditions possible as eyewall passes north of St. Croix.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft above normally dry ground possible on the southern coast of St. Croix, accompanied by large and destructive waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain expected; localized flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; short-fuse flash flooding in low-lying areas.
